dt: {bc}to feel a strong desire or craving especially for something not likely to be attained

pt: {sc}long{/sc} {sc}yearn{/sc} {sc}hanker{/sc} {sc}pine{/sc} {sc}hunger{/sc} {sc}thirst{/sc} mean to have a strong desire for something. {sc}long{/sc} implies a wishing with one's whole heart and often a striving to attain.
{sc}yearn{/sc} suggests an eager, restless, or painful longing.
{sc}hanker{/sc} suggests the uneasy promptings of unsatisfied appetite or desire.
{sc}pine{/sc} implies a languishing or a fruitless longing for what is impossible.
{sc}hunger{/sc} and {sc}thirst{/sc} imply an insistent or impatient craving or a compelling need.

pt.t: {it}hungered{/it} for a business of his own

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}langian{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}langēn{/it} to long, Old English {it}lang{/it} long
shortdef: to feel a strong desire or craving especially for something not likely to be attained
